text: The Argentina squad The fourteenth edition of the South American Championship of football was held in Buenos Aires, Argentina from December 27, 1936, to February 1, 1937. The participating countries were Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Paraguay, Peru, and Uruguay thus making this the first edition in which more than five teams took part of the event. Bolivia, and Colombia (a new CONMEBOL member) withdrew from the tournament. ==Venues== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! colspan=2 | Buenos Aires |- | Estadio Gasómetro de Boedo | Estadio Alvear y Tagle |- | Capacity: 75,000 | Capacity: 40,000 |- | 150px | 150px |} ==Final round== Chilean Raúl Toro, top scorer of the tournament Each team played against each of the other teams.
